column3: in toto corde meo~; in consìlio justórum et congregațióne. ^ I will praise thee
column5: with my whole heart~; in the council of the just and the congregation.

column2: exqŭisíta in òmnes voluntátes ejus. ^ Great are the works of the Lord
column3: sought out according to all his wills.

column2: et justìția ejus manet in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ His work is praise and magnificence
column3: and his justice continueth for ever and ever.

column1: 4 ^ Memóriam fečit mirabílium suórum~; misèricors et miserátor Dòminus. ^ He hath made a remembrance of his wonderful works~; merciful and gracious is the Lord.
5 ^ Éscam dèdit timèntibus se. Mèmor èrit in sáĕculum testamènti sui. ^ He hath given food to them that fear him. He will be mindful for ever of his covenant.
6 ^ virtútem óperum suórum adnunțiábit pòpulo suo
column2: ^ He will show forth to his people the power of his works

column1: 7 ^ ut det illîs hereditátem ǧèntium~; ópera mánuum ejus vèritas et judìčium. ^ that he may give them the inheritance of the Gentiles~; the works of his hands are truth and judgment.

column3: facta in veritáte et aĕqŭitáte. ^ All his commandments are faithful

column1: 9 ^ Redempțiónem misit pòpulo suo~; mandávit in aĕtèrnum testamèntum suum. sanctum
column2: et terrìbile nomen ejus. ^ He hath sent redemption to his people~; he hath commanded his covenant for ever. Holy and terrible is his name.

column1: 10 ^ Inìtium sapiènțiaĕ tìmor Dòmini~; intelléctus bonus òmnibus fačièntibus eum. Laŭdáțio ejus manet in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom~; a good understanding to all that do it. His praise continueth for ever and ever.
